To me the tablescape is almost as important as the food, especially during the holidays. A holiday gathering is all about creating a warm and inviting ambiance for your guests, and your decor — which includes platters and serveware — plays a pivotal role. Your setup doesn’t even have to be wildly elaborate. In fact, according to Food Network star Ina Garten, a solid-colored tablecloth, flowers, and fun accent plates are all you need to create the Thanksgiving table of your dreams. 

Of course, having enough serving dishes on hand is also a must. When hosting, I’ve discovered that you can never have too many platters and trays on hand. If you’re looking to start building out your collection (or add to it), T.J. Maxx has an option that looks so vintage — but without the steep price tag. The platter, which features a Thanksgiving-themed print that’s sure to stand out on your table, is going for only $30. It’s bound to sell out, so here’s why you need it before Turkey Day arrives.

What is the Eaton Fine Dining Vintage Turkey Pumpkin Platter?

Turkey is the star of the show on Thanksgiving, and its presentation should reflect that and all of the hours you spent preparing it. This 18.5- by 14.5-inch tray includes a nostalgic illustration of a turkey on top, surrounded by fall leaves and flowers around the border. The hues are muted and soft, giving it a true classic look that won’t overwhelm your table. The orange color around the border matches that in the turkey’s tail feathers, which ties the look together. As your guests eat, the retro design will gradually be revealed. 

The tray is dishwasher- and microwave-safe, to boot. The former is a huge selling point for me — I’m sure we can all agree that the cleanup is the worst part of hosting. At the end of the day, no one wants to spend just as much time cleaning as they did cooking, so having the option to pop the platter in the dishwasher is a huge lifesaver.

If you love the antique look of the platter as much as I do, the brand makes another version that pairs with it perfectly. The design is slightly different, with a larger and more vibrant turkey painted on the surface, but it also has the same border of flowers and leaves. That and their shared dimensions will make them a harmonious duo on your tabletop. While you use one for your main dish, the other can be used for any number of sides or appetizers. You’re sure to use them for holidays down the road, too, as well as in the weeks leading up to Thanksgiving — so don’t wait to grab them before they’re gone!

Buy: Eaton Fine Dining Vintage Turkey Pumpkin Platter, $29.99
